common

Interface ImageHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BoxHandler, ChunkHandler, IFDHandler, WebpHandler, XmpHandler

    public interface ImageHandler
    Defines the contract for a handler that processes image files and extracts structured metadata. Implementations are responsible for parsing binary image data and producing metadata in the form of a MetadataStrategy instance.

    This interface allows for extensibility to support different image formats, for example: TIFF, PNG, JPEG, etc, each with its own parsing and metadata representation logic.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      long getSafeFileSize()
      Returns the size of the image file being processed, in bytes.
      boolean parseMetadata()
      Parses the image data and attempts to extract metadata.

    • Method Detail

      • getSafeFileSize

        long getSafeFileSize()
        Returns the size of the image file being processed, in bytes.

        Any IOException that occurs while determining the size will be handled internally, and the method will return 0 if the size cannot be determined.

        Returns:
        the file size in bytes, or 0 if it cannot be determined

      • parseMetadata

        boolean parseMetadata()
               throws ImageReadErrorException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Parses the image data and attempts to extract metadata.

        Implementations should read the relevant sections of the image file and populate their internal metadata structures.

        Returns:
        true if metadata was successfully extracted, otherwise false
        Throws:
        ImageReadErrorException - if the file format is invalid or the data cannot be interpreted as valid metadata
        java.io.IOException - if a low-level I/O error occurs while reading the image file
